description: President Joe Biden said the chances of securing a cease-fire in the Israel-Hamas war are “looking tough” before the start of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan on Sunday.
title: Biden Says Gaza Cease-Fire ‘Tough’ to Reach Before Ramadan

description: Depending on whom you ask, the short-form video platform TikTok is either a showcase for goofy dances and makeup tutorials or a sophisticated threat to US national security. Because TikTok Inc. is owned by a Chinese company, ByteDance Ltd. — and because China requires its companies, upon request, to share any national security-related data with the government — TikTok’s popularity among Americans carries implications beyond the mobile-phone screen. That’s on top of hand-wringing by parents, educ
title: How TikTok Became a US-China National Security Issue

description: A federal judge declined to block a key Biden administration initiative that grants eligible immigrants from certain Latin American countries temporary residency in the US.
title: Biden Immigrant Residency Program Upheld by Federal Judge

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Some Other States Worth Watching in the 2024 Presidential Contest

description: Escalating violence in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo could turn into a regional conflict without increased political efforts to lower tensions, Jean-Pierre Lacroix, United Nations under-secretary-general for peace operations, said Friday.
title: UN Warns Congo Violence Escalating Into Regional Conflict

description: President Joe Biden brushed off criticism after referring to the alleged killer of a Georgia woman as an “illegal” during his State of the Union address.
title: Biden Shrugs Off ‘Illegal’ Remark That Drew Democrats’ Ire

description: President Joe Biden said he would sign a House bill that would force TikTok’s Chinese owners to sell the popular video-sharing app, his strongest show of support yet for the proposal.
title: Biden Backs Measure Forcing TikTok Sale as House Readies Vote

description: President Joe Biden declined to commit to debates with former President Donald Trump, saying his participation would hinge on the actions of his presumptive Republican opponent.
title: Biden Says Debates With Trump Depend on Opponent’s ‘Behavior’

description: France received a show of support from Baltic countries and Ukraine after President Emmanuel Macron irked other allies when he left the door open to sending troops to Ukraine.
title: France Drums Up Baltic Support for Ukraine After Troops Backlash

description: Three months after being kicked out of the US Congress and six months ahead of a federal criminal trial date, George Santos figures it’s time for a comeback.
title: George Santos, Expelled and Awaiting Trial, Tries for a Comeback

description: Kristalina Georgieva said Friday that she “would be honored” to serve a second term leading the International Monetary Fund.
title: IMF Chief Georgieva Says ‘Would Be Honored’ to Serve Second Term

description: A Pentagon office set up to investigate purported alien encounters dating back decades found no evidence to support claims that any of those incidents were actual sightings of extraterrestrials.
title: Pentagon Finds No Sign of Alien Life in Decades of UFO Sightings

description: The centrist group No Labels said Friday it’s moving forward with efforts to recruit a cross-party “unity ticket” to challenge Joe Biden and Donald Trump for the presidency after this week’s Super Tuesday primaries cemented a rematch of the 2020 election.
title: No Labels Moves Forward With White House ‘Unity Ticket’ Bid

description: Close allies of Donald Trump were named to the two top jobs at the Republican National Committee after the previous chair stepped down amid dissatisfaction with fundraising and coordination with the former president’s 2024 presidential campaign.
title: Trump Ally, Daughter-in-Law Snag Top Two Posts at RNC

description: Employment gains in the public sector more than offset losses among Canadian businesses last month, highlighting a labor market that has been propped up by government hiring.
title: Public Sector Hiring Is Driving the Labor Market in Canada

description: The latest round of trade talks between the UK and India appears set to end without a breakthrough on major outstanding issues, according to people familiar with the negotiations, meaning agreement is unlikely to be reached before India holds a general election.
title: India-UK Trade Talks Set to End With Key Issues Unresolved

description: The seven swing states most likely to decide the 2024 presidential election have been facing more economic misery than the rest of the US, adding an obstacle to President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign.
title: Swing-State Residents Lead Misery Index as 2024 Election Ignites

description: President Joe Biden’s campaign is looking to seize on momentum from his State of the Union address with a travel blitz designed to grab voters’ attention on his impending rematch with Donald Trump.
title: Biden Turns Up Heat on Trump With Swing State Travel Blitz

description: Donald Trump asked a judge to approve a bond covering the jury verdict against him in E. Jean Carroll’s defamation lawsuit while he appeals, appearing to abandon an earlier effort to put it on hold.
title: Trump Seeks Court Approval of $91.6 Million Bond Over Carroll

description: Rahul Gandhi, a senior leader with India’s main opposition party, the Indian National Congress, will contest the upcoming national elections from his current seat in the southern Indian state of Kerala, as the party released the names of some of the candidates who will contest the polls.
title: India’s Opposition Party Names First Set of Election Candidates

description: The European Union plans to put forward a negotiating framework for Ukraine’s accession talks as soon as next week as the war-torn country seeks to speed up its integration into the bloc, Commission Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis said.
title: EU Aims to Move Forward With Ukraine Accession Talks Next Week

description: Talks to revamp relations between Switzerland and the European Union will likely start this month.
title: Switzerland-EU Talks Will Likely Start in March, Government Says

description: Three of Poland’s central bank policymakers refused to support an opinion adopted at a meeting this week that called on the country’s ruling political party to desist from attempts to oust Governor Adam Glapinski.
title: Polish Central Bankers Split Over Plan to Probe Governor Glapinski

description: The House Education and the Workforce Committee added the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to the list of colleges it’s investigating over campus antisemitism in the wake of the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas on Israel.
title: MIT Dragged Into House Committee Investigation Over Antisemitism

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Westminster After May: Dawn Butler, Caroline Nokes on Being a Woman in Parliament

description: Since taking office in November, the 36-year-old president has declared war on cocaine cartels while also battling to prevent a financial meltdown
title: Stop Murders, Fight Drugs, Raise Taxes: Why Ecuador Loves Daniel Noboa

description: Desde que asumió el cargo en noviembre, el presidente de 36 años ha declarado la guerra a los carteles de la cocaína, al tiempo que lucha por evitar un colapso financiero.
title: Frenar asesinatos, combatir drogas, aumentar impuestos. Por eso Ecuador ama a Daniel Noboa

description: Armed men abducted hundreds of children from an elementary school in northern Nigeria, triggering a new security challenge in the West African nation that is dealing with a cost-of-living crisis.
title: Gunmen Abuct Hundreds of Elementary-School Children in Nigeria

description: An Irish election should be pushed back until as late as possible, the country’s finance minister said, as the incumbent government tries to fend off Sinn Fein, the increasingly popular left-wing party that has never governed in the Republic before.
title: Irish Vote Should Not Be Until 2025, Finance Minister Says

description: Ethiopia is considering scrapping a plan to recognize the breakaway state of Somaliland, amid international pressure to defuse regional tensions over the proposal, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ethiopia Mulls Scrapping Somaliland Recognition After Backlash

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Timing Is Everything for Israel-Hamas Truce

description: Russia’s compliance with its pledge to reduce crude oil output worsened slightly last month after reaching nearly 100% at the start of the year, according to Bloomberg calculations based on official data.
title: Russia’s Compliance With Oil-Output Cuts Slipped in February

description: The European Union, along with the United States and the United Arab Emirates, will launch a maritime corridor to deliver humanitarian aid to Palestinians in Gaza amid mounting alarm about the conditions there.
title: EU, US to Launch Maritime Corridor to Deliver Aid to Gaza

description: Mali will be able to reduce power cuts during the month of Ramadan, thanks to a fuel donation from Russia.
title: Russia’s Fuel Gift to Help Mali Keep Lights on During Ramadan

description: Russia is intensifying disinformation attacks against democratic countries in an effort to turn allies against each other and create friction ahead of European Union and US elections, according to Romania’s foreign minister.
title: Russia Pits Democratic Leaders Against Each Other, Romania Warns

description: Trump is campaigning to return to the White House while facing multiple looming criminal and civil trials — a challenge no other candidate in US history has ever faced. These legal timelines help make sense of it all
title: Timelines of Trump’s Legal Cases as He Runs for President in 2024

description: The euro-area economy’s failure to expand in the fourth quarter was down to a plunge in trade.
title: Euro Area’s Failure to Grow Was Down to Year-End Trade Slump

description: French and Ukrainian defense groups plan to create partnerships to bolster Kyiv’s war effort, notably to provide drones and spare parts, France’s defence minister, Sebastien Lecornu, told RMC radio.
title: French Defense Groups to Partner With Ukraine, Minister Says

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Friday will visit his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, a crucial weapons supplier for Kyiv as the country seeks to bolster support for its defense against Russia’s invasion.
title: Zelenskiy Travels to Turkey in Bid to Shore Up Defense Support

description: Turkish policymakers are having to revert to old habits with the approach of elections and the lira selling off, sidestepping the prospect of higher interest rates in favor of micro-managing lenders to keep the currency in check.
title: Midnight Decrees Hound Banks Again in Turkish Election Deja Vu

description: Former Prime Minister Theresa May won’t seek another term as a member of Parliament, one of the most senior Conservatives to step aside as the ruling party braces for an uphill election battle later this year.
title: Ex-Prime Minister Theresa May Won’t Seek Re-Election as MP

description: The United Nations’ atomic watchdog reiterated demands for Russia to return Europe’s largest nuclear power plant to Ukrainian control amid concern that deteriorating safety could lead to a meltdown.
title: Nuclear Watchdog Demands Russia End Occupation of Ukraine Plant

description: Hong Kong published a 212-page bill on Friday for its proposed new security law, which the government is seeking to fast-track into legislation.
title: Here Are the Crimes & Punishments Under HK’s New Security Bill

description: Portugal will hold an election this weekend after the sudden resignation of Prime Minister Antonio Costa, giving voters a chance to either stick with the Socialists or opt for change and join the shift to the right seen across Europe.
title: Portugal’s Far Right Party Looks to Capitalize on Protest Vote

description: President Joe Biden cast himself as the bulwark against the rising tide of threats to democracy, painting his predecessor Donald Trump as responsible for those perils.
title: Key Takeaways From Biden’s State of the Union Address

description: India has cut prices on liquefied petroleum gas cylinders by 100 rupees to ease financial burden on households, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced on X, formerly known as Twitter.
title: India Slashes Cooking Gas Prices Ahead of National Election

description: New York Republican George Santos announced Thursday that he would make another run for a New York House seat after being expelled by his colleagues in December.
title: George Santos Announces Another Run for New York House Seat

description: This is his 2024 speech as prepared for his address to a joint session of Congress.
title: Read Biden’s Complete State of the Union Remarks

description: India’s opposition alliance is well behind in the polls ahead of an election set to be announced shortly. One key member is warning that Prime Minister Narendra Modi faces trouble if his ruling party wins the most seats but fails to secure a majority in parliament.
title: Modi Faces ‘Pandora’s Box’ If No Majority, India Opposition Says

description: Republican Scott Baugh and Democrat Dave Min are the top two voter getters in the primary race for California’s 47th Congressional District, according to AP.
title: Baugh, Min Advance in California House Race for Porter Seat

description: The Hong Kong government published a draft of a new security law aimed at safeguarding the Chinese state, kicking off a fast-tracked process to complete legislation that once divided the former British colony.
title: HK Publishes Article 23 Draft as It Fast-Tracks New Security Law

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un guided military drills that included fire from an artillery unit capable of hitting Seoul, stepping up threats against his neighbor that coincide with it hold joint military training with the US.
title: Kim Jong Un Leads Drills by Artillery Unit That Can Strike Seoul

description: US President Joe Biden Photographer: Jim Lo Scalzo/EPA
title: Biden Aims to Counter Voter Angst on Economy in Speech
